summary: Build a quiz app named "Dev Classes" for a teacher to conduct topic-wise tests: teacher can create questions and students can take quizzes/tests.
imageRequirements:
## Required Images
- Minimal modern wordmark logo reading "Dev Classes" on transparent background (dev-classes-logo.dim_512x512.png)
- Warm, classroom-inspired abstract header background with subtle educational motifs (dev-classes-hero-bg.dim_1600x600.png)

existing_features.title: Create the core app structure and navigation for a quiz app named "Dev Classes" with two primary user journeys: (1) teacher creates and manages topic-wise quizzes and questions, and (2) student selects a topic/quiz and takes a test.
Implement Internet Identity login and a simple role model (Teacher vs Student) so the same app can support quiz creation (teacher-only) and quiz taking (student).
Teacher UI: Provide screens to create and manage Topics, create Quizzes under a Topic, and add/edit/remove multiple-choice Questions (with 2â€“6 options and a single correct option).

Student UI: Provide a flow to browse Topics and Quizzes, take a quiz question-by-question or as a single form, submit answers, and view the result (score and basic review of correct vs chosen answers).

Frontend: Add a coherent, distinctive visual theme for "Dev Classes" and apply it consistently across pages (typography, spacing, buttons, cards, and form styles). Avoid blue/purple as the primary palette.
Add the required generated static images into the app and use them in the UI (e.g., header/landing area) by serving them from frontend/public/assets/generated (no backend image routing).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create "Dev Classes" quiz app for topic-wise tests (teacher creates questions; students take tests).
Backend: Add persistent data models and CRUD APIs to support topic-wise quizzes: Topics, Quizzes (linked to a Topic), Questions (linked to a Quiz), and multiple-choice options with a correct answer.

Backend: Store quiz attempts/results per student (by principal) for each quiz, and expose APIs for (a) a student to view their own past attempts and (b) a teacher to view aggregated results per quiz (e.g., list of attempts).
